page.title: 19WEATHER CONDITIONS
page.content: sThe{weather}in this part of Britain can be very cruel at times. Most winters see a great deal of{snow falling and much{drifting}results due to the wind that often blows. This drifting means that on occasions in the winter the area is cut off from the outside world. However this does not usualkly last long due to the excellent work done by{Snow Ploughs. In winter the wind comes from the {north east}and can be extremely cold. Nearly every home in the area faces south due to this wind and many homes have few if any windows facing north. In the summer the wind is a{south {westerly}but the general openess of the area tends to lead to{cool {temperatures.}Problems can arise in {dry spells}as homes, farms and school are dependant on{wells}which often dry up in{droughts.
